newsitem.title: SWEDEN: EMU worries push Swedish shares to lower close.
newsitem.headline: EMU worries push Swedish shares to lower close.

text.p: Worries about Europe's economic and monetary union (EMU) depressed Swedish shares on Thursday.
"There is confusion about EMU both locally and internationally so nobody wants to bet much on the upside," a trader said. "The downside is also limited as the U.S. shows it has a very strong bourse.
The Stockholm bourse's general index fell 0.96 percent to close at 2,812.89 in turnover of 4.16 billion crowns.
Construction company Skanska was among losers and fell eight crowns to 311.

The share was hurt by a tax committee ruling Skanska would have to pay capital gains tax on its sale of shares in engineer Sandvik, a deal worth about 10 billion crowns. Skanska said, however, that it would appeal.
But automotive group Volvo withstood negative trends and ended flat at 216, supported by a strong order intake on trucks, strong car sales and its share redemption.
Cyclical steel and forestry shares were hurt as investors turned away from them for the second consecutive day after favouring them for a couple of weeks. The forestry sector fell 1.62 percent.

ABB Sweden edged down marginally on news Kazakhstan annulled its 1.4 billion framework agreement with Swiss-Swedish ABB AG Power Consortium Ltd. The share was already trading down two crowns and it closed the session 2.5 lower at 106.5.
Drug company Astra fell two crowns to 127.
